subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Saturday, 09 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Bentley responds to U21 criticism
Blackburn's David Bentley defends withdrawing from the England U21 squad for the European Championship because of fatigue.



 
England stars to play for nothing
England's footballers are set to raise more than £1m for charity by donating their match fees.



 
Aliadiere agrees to Boro transfer
Arsenal striker Jeremie Aliadiere agrees to join Middlesbrough.








GOLF




McEvoy poised to strike in Vienna
England's Richard McEvoy is three shots behind leader Richard Green after the third round of the Austrian Open.



 
St Jude Championship leaderboard




 
My wife tried to stab me - Daly
American John Daly claims his wife tried to stab him with a steak knife in Memphis, where he is competing at the St Jude Championship.








MOTORSPORT




Live - Canadian GP qualifying
McLaren and Ferrari renew their battle for pole in sunny conditions in Montreal.



 
Hamilton flies in final practice
McLaren sensation Lewis Hamilton sets the fastest time in the third and final practice session at the Canadian GP.



 
Rossi to start on Barcelona pole
Valentino Rossi claims pole for Sunday's Catalunya MotoGP, with Randy de Puniet second and Dani Pedrosa third.








FORMULA ONE




Live - Canadian GP qualifying
McLaren and Ferrari renew their battle for pole in sunny conditions in Montreal.



 
Hamilton flies in final practice
McLaren sensation Lewis Hamilton sets the fastest time in the third and final practice session at the Canadian GP.



 
Alonso sets early Canada GP pace
McLaren's Fernando Alonso is fastest in both of Friday's practice sessions for the Canadian Grand Prix.








ATHLETICS




Devonish delivers relay warning
Marlon Devonish says Britain should avoid rushing its next batch of sprint talent into the senior international arena.



 
British duo claim wins in Turin
Tim Benjamin wins the 400m and Marlon Devonish the 100m at Friday's meeting in Turin.



 
Ban 'almost destroyed' Ohuruogu
Christine Ohuruogu's coach Lloyd Cowan says it has been a difficult job to get his charge back on track after her suspension.








CYCLING




Tour takes Riis off winners list
Tour de France organisers say they no longer consider Bjarne Riis the 1996 race winner after his drugs confession.



 
Belgian police make doping raids
An assistant from Belgian cycling team Quick-Step is questioned after a series of drugs raids.



 
Thomas toasts 'dream' Tour place
Wales's Geraint Thomas is celebrating a "dream come true" with his ride in next month's Tour de France confirmed.








FUN AND GAMES




Comment: Becks for good
Robbo on Beckham's return for England



 
Ramprakash goes dancing again
Strictly Come Dancing star Mark Ramprakash breaks out a few of his best moves ahead of Surrey's Twenty20 campaign this summer.



 
Hatton gets new nickname
Boxer changing his name to the 'Manchester Mexican'
